VMM's revenue increased by 23.2% year-on-year (YoY), supported by new store openings and a Same Store Sales Growth (SSSG) of 13.4%.

Apparel was the largest contributor to revenue at approximately 41%, while FMCG and general merchandise each contributed around 29%.

Gross margin expanded by 182 basis points (bps) to 28.3%, partly due to apparel's increased revenue share.

EBITDA margin also expanded by 191 bps YoY to 14.0%, primarily driven by the improved gross margin.

VMM continued with its new store opening plans, supported by a strong category mix favoring apparel and a significant contribution from its own brands.

A positive outlook for VMM was maintained, based on its growth trajectory, store expansion plans, category mix, and strong private label share.

A "Buy" rating was maintained with a target price (TP) of INR 140.

The company was expected to generate substantial operating and free cash flow over FY25â€“28 to support its expansion.

Own brands contributed significantly to revenue, accounting for 73.1% in FY25.

VMM expanded its quick commerce initiative to 656 stores across 429 cities, reaching 8.7 million registered users.

A fire incident was reported at one of VMM's outlets.

On May 1, 2025, Vishal Mega Mart (VMM) reported strong Q4FY25 results and positive financial performance, alongside expansion plans.

Expansion and Future Outlook:

In summary, as of May 1, 2025, Vishal Mega Mart demonstrated strong financial performance in Q4FY25 and outlined plans for continued growth through store expansion and digital initiatives.
